intro: Strychnos abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian strychnos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Ethiopia and parts of East Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are attractive to birds and other wildlife. It is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
